quiz_1_question.eng: True or False: It is okay to give into your child if they continue to whine or have a tantrum.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:

quiz_2_question.eng:
How you respond to your child really matters. Hereâ€™s one more question to consider. 

True or False: You should tell your child to stop complaining and threaten to hit them if they continue.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng:
âŒ Thatâ€™s incorrect. 

ğŸ’š Telling your child to stop or threatening them canmake things worse. Hitting will only teach your child that violence is an acceptable solution to problems. It is also against the law. 

âœ¨ Instead, explain in a calm way why, then try to redirect your child to something else. 

ğŸ’™ If your child continues or loses control, remain calm and stay with your child without engaging in an argument. It may be difficult but eventually they will calm down too. Then you can attend to their needs.

rows.text_1_facilitator: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are tips you can use when your child is whining or throwing tantrums:

text_1_facilitator.eng: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are tips you can use when your child is whining or throwing tantrums:

section_1_text.eng:
1ï¸âƒ£ REDIRECT

ğŸ¨ Try to redirect your child's attention to a positive behaviour or activity. 
ğŸŒ· Praise them for this positive behaviour!

section_2_text.eng:
âœ‹Take a Pause and take some deep breaths. It will help you stay calm and be able to see clearly what your child needs.

ğŸ˜£ It is very tempting to reduce your reaction to your childâ€™s level by shouting, especially when the tantrum doesnâ€™t stop, or youâ€™re tired and your patience is running out.

ğŸ“Try to have a plan prepared for helping yourself in situations when you feel like you might explode and yell.

ğŸ’š Stay near your child and be a reassuring presence. You remaining calm will help your child calm down.

section_3_text.eng:
ğŸŒ± Ask yourself, â€œwhat does your child really need at this moment? Are they tired, stressed, afraid?â€ 

ğŸ’› Most of the time, your child may be needing attention or love. 

ğŸ’™ You can give them this without giving into their demands if they are whining for something they cannot have.

section_4_text.eng:
ğŸˆ Once your child has calmed down from a tantrum, they will need lots of love and attention on positive behaviour.

ğŸ§¸ You can talk about what happened later or the next day. For now, involve your child in a positive activity.

section_5_text.eng:
â­ Even if your child behaves even worse at first when you do not give in, it is important to continue staying calm without getting into an argument or shouting at your child. 

âœ¨You can calmly explain the reason why your child cannot have something, but do it only once without engaging in a debate or argument. 

ğŸ”„ Over time, your child will learn how to become calm by themselves. 

ğŸ’š Spend lots of positive time with your child - especially one-on-one time!

rows.quiz_1_question:
Here is todayâ€™s home activity! â­ Find one positive thing your child does today and praise them for it. If your child starts whining about something or having a tantrum, try to use the tips from this lesson to redirect, stay calm, observe, and nurture. It may not be easy to do at first, but you can do it!

Can you find something to praise your child for today? â°

quiz_1_question.eng:
Here is todayâ€™s home activity! â­ Find one positive thing your child does today and praise them for it. If your child starts whining about something or having a tantrum, try to use the tips from this lesson to redirect, stay calm, observe, and nurture. It may not be easy to do at first, but you can do it!

Can you find something to praise your child for today? â°

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great! ğŸ’™ Praising our children means they are more likely to repeat this positive behaviour.Keeping calm when your child is having a tantrum can be hard, but if you are patient and give it time, it really works.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's OK! ğŸ’™ Praising our children for positive behaviour means they are more likely to repeat it!
